boat.name: Fortuna lll
boat.full_description:
A Hillyard 28' wooden Bermudan cutter, 7 ton, built 1931 and on the Hillyard Register, 'Fortuna III' is recognised as a sister ship to the 'Nancy Blackett' (Arthur Ransomes' yacht).

Unusually, for a larger Hillyard, she is transom sterned and was originally a masthead sloop. She was placed on the market in April, 2018 when the following was included in the sale notice: "The hull appears sound and watertight but is currently in primer and needing a topcoat. The interior is sound but in need of attention, retaining most of its original fittings. Full standing headroom, no heads. Currently cutter rigged with retracting furling gear fitted to bowspit and a tabernacle stepped mast. Traditional red sails in useable condition. Engine is said to be serviceable. Good useable cockpit tent/cover. Mast butt end has a split but this could be easily repaired."
boat.short_description: 'Fortuna III' is a Hillyard 28' wooden Bermudan cutter, built in 1931 and recognised as the sister ship to Arthur Ransome's 'Nancy Blackett'.
